intro: Lepidaploa liesneri, commonly known as the Liesner's lepidaploa, is a rare and lesser-known plant species belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and compound leaves with finely divided leaflets. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
